travels.title: Scotland '04
travels.headertext: We visited Scotland in March of 2004. The weather for most of the trip was very 'Scottish', rather cold and wet. Of course, it was March, so we did expect it.

entry.text: We started in Edinburgh. The castle is the centerpiece of the town.
Of course, I also had to see the botanical garden. Although the weather wasn't the greatest, things were just starting to bloom.

After Edinburgh, we headed out into the countryside. We stayed near Fort William, just south of Loch Ness. From there we explored around the loch and up to Inverness. The Scottish country side is like what you hear - a lot of open 'heaths'. The snow covered peak is Ben Nevis, highest point in Scotland at a 'towering' 4406 feet.
Urquhart Castle on the shores of Loch Ness. It's been there since the Middle Ages. The best part - being March we had the place almost to ourselves. During summer, the place would be mobbed.
There's a lot of good hiking in Scotland. This was on a hike just outside Fort William. You hike up into a valley. This was in a cut, just before getting into the valley.
We met this guy and his friends on the way back from the hike. I guess even the cows need good fur for the Scottish winters.
